Name: A Night of Shimmering Stars
Description: You helped a student named Ang recover her stargazing guide. To her, it's more than just a booklet; it carries the weight of a promise she shared with her friends…
QuestDesc: You helped a student named Ang recover her stargazing guide. To her, it's more than just a booklet; it carries the weight of a promise she shared with her friends…

Dialogues.Speaker: Ang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's odd... Where did I put it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, {PlayerName}, you came at just the right time. Have you spotted a thin booklet in the lecture hall with a plain cover?

Options.PlotLineKey: Maybe I can help you look for it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Really? Thanks, {PlayerName}. I remember after I took the booklet out, I never left the lecture hall.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've searched through this side of the lecture hall. Let's split up and check the other side.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Great, you found it, {PlayerName}.

Options.PlotLineKey: So you're planning to go stargazing?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Yes. And not just me, my friends will be there too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We made this promise when we first came to Startorch Academy. But the school system and personal pursuits have sent us to different departments.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We don't really talk or hang out like before. We have so much to tell, and so many stories to share, but we rarely find the right moment.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So we figured we needed something to bring us back together. To everyone else, my friends and I probably just look like the quiet and boring type…

Dialogues.Speaker: Ang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fireworks or big, loud parties aren't really our style. So we chose something you just have to look up to see—the stars.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We can lie under the stars, talk about the things we love, and enjoy the tranquility that's just for us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I was just going through this guide, trying to find the perfect time and spot to see the stars so I could tell my friends.

Options.PlotLineKey: I might have an idea for the perfect spot...

Dialogues.Speaker: Ang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh? The Spacetrek Observatory's already been rebuilt? If that's the case, it's definitely the best stargazing spot.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Would you like to join us, {PlayerName}? The guide says tonight's sky will be especially beautiful.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then let's go tell my friends the news.

Dialogues.Speaker: Romeo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...The "Fundamentals of Phase Coating Theory and Techniques" exam is on Monday. Great, I haven't read a single chapter yet...

Dialogues.Speaker: Romeo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then there's the "Consciousness Field Theory" exam on Tuesday. That one's okay, I guess. Just one big chapter left to go through… Not like the earlier chapters gave much away for the answers anyway.

Dialogues.Speaker: Romeo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wednesday, "Roya Socio-Cultural History." I'll cram it on Wednesday morning. And there's the campus virtual idol online concert this weekend, so it'll be another all-nighter...

Dialogues.Speaker: Ang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What about today?

Dialogues.Speaker: Romeo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Today? Today I just feel like going outside and looking up at the sky... Oh, Ang, you're here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Looks like our busy bee at least subconsciously remembered our promise. So, what do you say? I already checked the guide for tonight's best stargazing time.

Options.PlotLineKey: The Spacetrek Observatory is now open as well.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Right, this is my classmate {PlayerName}. We found the perfect time and spot for stargazing. Now all we need are the right people to be there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Romeo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course I won't miss something like this...

Dialogues.Speaker: Ang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But your courses...

Dialogues.Speaker: Romeo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Studying is all about balancing work and rest. But whether I work first or rest first… well, that's up to myself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Okay, but do take care of yourself. I'd feel terrible if you ditched your studies because of us. See you at 10 tonight.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, that's everyone from our side invited. {PlayerName}, is there anyone you'd like to bring along?

Options.PlotLineKey: Since we're heading to the Spacetrek Observatory... I do have someone in mind.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cool. Let's all get ready and meet at the Spacetrek Observatory tonight at ten.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hilings
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Phew... Finally, a message!

Dialogues.Speaker: Hilings
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Dear user, complete your transaction now to enjoy... Ugh, that same message again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hilings
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Great, the only things hitting my phone this week are just spam texts and the Academy's drink bot.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hilings
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Has everyone really forgotten it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You mean our promise to watch the stars?

Dialogues.Speaker: Hilings
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ang!

Dialogues.Speaker: Ang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sorry, I've been a bit busy lately. I'm only getting around to telling you today.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, and this is {PlayerName}, from my department...

Options.PlotLineKey: I'm joining your stargazing at the Spacetrek Observatory.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hilings
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Observatory? You mean we can actually go to a real observatory to watch the stars? Wait, my camera! Where's my camera...?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No need to over-prepare. Our great photographer can make do with a phone or the Terminal camera this time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't be fooled by how unreliable he seems, {PlayerName}. He's actually the most perceptive of us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He fell in love with photography. Instead of trying to invent something that would shock the world, he'd rather make a B movie that genuinely moves people.

Options.PlotLineKey: Does it have to be a low-budget film?

Dialogues.Speaker: Hilings
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course, it's way cooler when a crappy movie still moves people.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright, then tonight's shoot is in the hands of our future B-movie director. Let's meet at 10 p.m., {PlayerName}. We should go tell my other friend.

Dialogues.Speaker: Dhalifa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}? What brings you here?

Dialogues.Speaker: Dhalifa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, don't worry. Everything still looks normal. And if anything does come up again, I promise I won't try to handle it alone.

Options.PlotLineKey: Actually, I came for something else too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Dhalifa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Something else?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Want to go stargazing at the Spacetrek Observatory together? Since it was rebuilt, you've been busy recruiting and handling all the follow-up work. I don't think I've seen you take a real break.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: According to the Lahai-Roi Stargazing Guide, the Sky Projection Array will simulate a one-of-a-kind sky tonight.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's the perfect chance to set your duties aside and just be an ordinary stargazer, to really soak in the beauty and wonder for yourself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Dhalifa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To soak in the beauty and wonder as an ordinary stargazer... Mm-hmm, let's go together.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're here, {PlayerName}! Oh, so you invited Miss Dhalifa!

Dialogues.Speaker: Dhalifa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mm-hmm, Ang once asked me about some basic astronomy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe, it's never too late to arrive tonight. Lahai-Roi's starry sky was just waiting for one more audience.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, look at those stars in a circle. Don't they kind of look like the "modified Startack" on Professor Mornye's head?

Dialogues.Speaker: Hilings
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah, they're so bright. Thanks to Professor Mornye and the others, we can now see such a beautiful night sky.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hilings
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And look over there. If you connect those stars, it totally looks like Professor Carl's big nose.

Dialogues.Speaker: Romeo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then those stars must have a runny nose, kinda like they're saying in a really stuffy voice, "Wow, what a one hot pile of academic junk!"

Dialogues.Speaker: Ang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, then that shooting star must be… their trail of snot.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hilings
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ew, that sounds gross.

Dialogues.Speaker: Romeo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Indeed. What do you think, {PlayerName}? Miss Dhalifa?

Options.PlotLineKey: I actually think it's kind of fun.

Dialogues.Speaker: Dhalifa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha. Well, snot or shooting star, how about we make a wish on it anyway?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sure!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Together, you all look up at the sky and quietly make your own wishes…

Dialogues.Speaker: Romeo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So... what did you guys wish for?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Shh, you can't say it out loud or it won't come true.

Dialogues.Speaker: Dhalifa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha. Would you help me capture this moment under the stars? I'd love to keep it forever.

Dialogues.Speaker: Dhalifa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How about this spot?

Dialogues.Speaker: Dhalifa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you, {PlayerName}, for inviting me here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Dhalifa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thanks to that, I'm more certain about the Observatory's purpose. It's not just about controlling Lahai-Roi's climate...

Dialogues.Speaker: Dhalifa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now it also carries everyone's hopes for something beautiful. If I could still see a starry sky like tonight's for another hundred or even a thousand times...

Dialogues.Speaker: Dhalifa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't think I'll ever get tired of it!

Dialogues.Speaker: Romeo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I still want to know... what did you all just wish for?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not telling you. But... it does have something to do with all of us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I want to see starry nights like tonight countless more times. Will you still be with me by then?

Dialogues.Speaker: Hilings
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course I will. It'd be pretty lonely to let you have this whole sky all to yourself, wouldn't it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah. {PlayerName}, did you have a good time tonight?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's great! Thank you for watching the stars with us. If you don't mind, we would like to invite you again next time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whenever you're ready, welcome aboard. The three of us will be here for you, always.
